showScoreExcerpt:
Purlie Victorious commits to the power of theatre to make people uncomfortable, and also the value and necessity of doing so. In todayâ€™s world of short attention spans, many of us are used to being able to stop watching when something pushes us too far, but in a theatre we don't have that luxury. I'm grateful for theatrical spaces that makes people sit with their discomfort, process it, ride it out, and keep going. In addition to laughter, the play evoked serious ideas to ponder and percolate.
